original_solution_mapping.L1: The best player averages 5 hits a game because 25 / 5 = <<25/5=5>>5
original_solution_mapping.L2: The rest of the team averages 10 hits a game because 15 - 5 = <<15-5=10>>10
original_solution_mapping.L3: The rest of the players average 1 hit a game because 10 / 10 = <<10/10=1>>1
original_solution_mapping.L4: They will average 6 hits per player over the next 6 games because 6 x 1 = <<6*1=6>>6

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3615.
    Returns: the average hits per player across the next 6 games for the other players.
    """
    # L1
    best_player_total_hits = 25 # Their best player has 25 total hits
    initial_games_played = 5 # over their first 5 games
    best_player_avg_hits_per_game = best_player_total_hits / initial_games_played

    # L2
    team_avg_hits_per_game = 15 # averaged 15 hits per game
    rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game = team_avg_hits_per_game - best_player_avg_hits_per_game

    # L3
    total_players = 11 # There are 11 players on the team
    num_other_players = total_players - 1
    avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game = rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game / num_other_players

    # L4
    next_games_count = 6 # over the next 6 games
    avg_hits_per_other_player_next_games = next_games_count * avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game

    # FA
    answer = avg_hits_per_other_player_next_games
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The best player averages {best_player_avg_hits_per_game} hits a game because {best_player_total_hits} / {initial_games_played} = <<{best_player_total_hits}/{initial_games_played}={best_player_avg_hits_per_game}>>{best_player_avg_hits_per_game}

The rest of the team averages {rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game} hits a game because {team_avg_hits_per_game} - {best_player_avg_hits_per_game} = <<{team_avg_hits_per_game}-{best_player_avg_hits_per_game}={rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game}>>{rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game}

The rest of the players average {avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game} hit a game because {rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game} / {num_other_players} = <<{rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game}/{num_other_players}={avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game}>>{avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game}

They will average {avg_hits_per_other_player_next_games} hits per player over the next {next_games_count} games because {next_games_count} x {avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game} = <<{next_games_count}*{avg_hits_per_other_player_per_game}={avg_hits_per_other_player_next_games}>>{avg_hits_per_other_player_next_games}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The best player averages 5 hits a game because 25 / 5 = <<25/5=5>>5
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The rest of the team averages 10 hits a game because 15 - 5 = <<15-5=10>>10

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'rest_of_team_avg_hits_per_game' (value: 10.0) was reported instead of 'avg_hits_per_other_player_next_games' (value: 6.0).
